TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9743=I love waking up in my apartment everyday knowing that I am a pirate. I bleed purple and gold! I have LOVED ECU since stepping on campus in August of 2008, and have made and met unforgettable friendships that will definitely last a lifetime. The atmosphere is amazing, the town locals are VERY kind, and the attitude of success here at East Carolina is alive, as each and every student knows just what it means to study hard, and excel in the classroom!, 708065=There are many traditions at ECU. Firstly, we are the pirates, and what do pirates say? ARGH! If someone yells PURPLE!, you yell GOLD! (our school colors). A football tradition that started in 2008 is the raising of the No Quarter flag during the fourth quarter of a football game. Real pirates would raise a no quarter flag to show the other ship that they will take no prisoners and give no quarter (or mercy). That is exactly what the ECU pirates do in the fourth quarter, give no mercy. Fans in the stands participate by holding up their arms in the air crossed, like a skull and cross bones. There is also one strange tradition that I know of. People will tell you that walking under the cupola in the mall (a small dome/gazebo looking thing in a grass field in central campus) will cause you to not graduate on time. I do not know if this is true or not, but I would not try it in any case., 888819=Take the COAD 1000 class. Learn to manage your time wisely. Do not over fill your daily schedule. College Hill is closest to the stadium, so if you are planning on being in the band or color guard, that would be the best place for you. It is not unusual to hear a person yell Purple! from one side of campus, only to be greeted with a Gold! from the other side.
